full_text: Kõuvõ is a versatile piece that can be worn both as a headband and a hat. The piece is knit in the round with a narrow folded edge. After casting off a number of stitches, the leaf-like flap is knit flat. Kõuvõ means “birch” in Livonian, an endangered language once spoken by the Livonian people in the territory of modern-day Latvia and Estonia. Sizes available: Child, Adult Small, (Adult Medium, Adult Large) Finished length of cowl portion: 18, 22, (22, 22) cm/ 7, 8¾, (8¾, 8¾) inches. Finished circumference, stretched: approx. 40, 50, (58, 64) cm/ 16, 20, (22¾, 24¾) inches. The sample was knit in the size Adult Medium. Gauge: 20 sts x 19 rows = 5x5 cm/ 2x2 inches in 2x2 rib, unstretched. Yarn: Fingering weight yarn (plus approx. 10% buffer): 110, 172, (205, 232)m/120, 188, (224, 254)yds/27, 42, (50, 57)g. In case you don’t have a full skein and wish to maximise the length of the tubular portion, yarn amounts needed for the leaf flap only are provided in the pattern. Photography by Arturs Bogdanovs
